text: Thamnocalamus is a genus of clumping bamboo in the grass family.Munro, William. 1868. Transactions of the Linnean Society of London 26(1): 33-35 descriptions in Latin, commentary in English These species are found from the Himalayas as well as Madagascar and Southern Africa.Flora of China Vol. 22 Page 73 筱竹属 xiao zhu shu Thamnocalamus Munro, Trans. Linn. Soc. London. 26: 33. 1868Chao, C. & S. A. Renvoize. 1989. A revision of the species described under Arundinaria (Gramineae) in southeast Asia and Africa. Kew Bulletin 44(2): 349–367 Thamnocalamus is closely related to Fargesia. The two genera are sometimes regarded as a single genus by some authors.Ohrnberger, D. 1999. The bamboos of the world: annotated nomenclature and literature of the species and the higher and lower taxa.
